Posts.Content: Dec 12, 2013 05:46PM HappySpring13 wrote: Hi everyone!! I had my BMX on Dec 4 and today they finally pulled the last two drains. The first two they did on Monday Dec 9 and what a relief that was. Doing my happy dance . So tonight will be my first night sleeping drain free. Anyone find it painful to sleep at night? I don't have much pain during the day, but at night when I go to lay down, it hurts. It hurts enough to wake me up that I have to sleep sitting up. Does it ever get better? I have TE's in place and plan to do silicon implants in about 3 months and nipple recon soon following that. What's the turning point where life can feel a little more normal? @ SWIMMOM2 - I saw my PS today and I'm still in a surgical bra and he said I can wear sport bras but no underwire. My drains are out as of today. Since I can't lift my hands over my head yet, I will have to still wear it. I feel like a T-Rex with little baby arms.
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Dec 30, 2013 06:29PM HappySpring13 wrote: bobogirl - so sorry to hear you are in the hospital for infection.  Hopefully they can treat the infection with IV antibiotics and you can be on your way.  But if the TE has to come out, you will get better and start again.  Just try to stay strong.  We all go through crap and have set backs.  It's journey we are on together.   I'm about 4 weeks out BMX with TE's and I know I can still get an infection at anytime.  However, when I read about the other women on this forum and the things they have been through, they remained strong and took whatever was thrown at them.  I find strength with these ladies and their strength is what guides me everyday.  So I hope you are doing okay and know there are people thinking about you right now.

Posts.Content: Jan 4, 2014 06:02PM HappySpring13 wrote: WW - I love what you said.  That made me laugh.  Thanks for that. I was a D before and took pictures to remember me....but now even with my TE's in place, they are high and tight.  So that part I like so far.  I had saline implants before and was thinking it was time for a change when I got the dx.  Strange how things happen. When I told this friend I know, she kinda went batty and said "I never go for mammograms, you can't trust the results. And my daughter is a nurse and she never goes for one".    I didn't know how to respond to that, so I just said everyone does whats good for them and left it at that. People just get scared and you can't blame them for that.

Posts.Content: Jan 6, 2014 03:12PM HappySpring13 wrote: Piano-girl = I am also about 4 weeks bmx with TE's and my PS gave me a booklet of stretching exercises to do.  That was about 2 weeks post op.  Can you ask your BS to see if she has one?  I find if you do them everyday, it really helps.  Although I get lazy and skip a day or two.  I checked out that youtube video and some of the exercises are different from my book.  I will be doing them now too.  Thanks for posting that.  Also I wanted to say is that I went for a 2nd fill up in my TE's and I asked the nurse about my tightness and exercising and she said I was supposed to wait 4 - 6 weeks before starting stretching. Like WW said, everyone has a different opinion on when to start.  Just don't push yourself hard.  Like the youtube video states, do what you can and deep breaths.  In time, you will be yourself again.

Swimmom - I just had my second fill yesterday.  50cc so I am at 400 cc.  300 cc at time of surgery.  These rocks are getting harder and harder.  I told my husband about my exchange date and he gave me a dumb look and said why can't you just keep the TE's...LOL.  Poor thing is confused at whats going on.  So I made him feel my rocks and said this is why!  Let us know when you get your exchange date.

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2014 08:15AM HappySpring13 wrote: I only had the cancer in the right breast.  Doctor did use the dye for mapping, but I was surprised to learn when I got my path report that he took 4 nodes from left breast which had no cancer.  Looks like I have questions for BS when I see him in June.  So it might be ALND on my left side which was no cancer...that really stinks!!  So now when I see my regular doctor and he needs blood and BP, tell them to take from my leg?
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2014 05:29PM HappySpring13 wrote: Njmom3 - that's what happened to me.   When the PS took out my very last drain, only one side did I have excruciating pain which I felt in my shoulder blade.  The other drains I didn't really have an issue with.  This one however, I was seeing stars.  Even for about a week to two weeks after the drain was removed I was having unexplained pain in that same spot. It would come and go, but when it came on, it made me stop in place and I would keep checking too to see if a bruise would develop or if the area was red.  I even had my mom looking and touching.  Couldn't explain it. It was under the skin in that one little area.  My guess now is that the drain was sitting on a nerve and when the drain was pulled out it upset the area.  At this point it went away, but I was concerned for a while wondering why I had it.  I thought it strange to have pain in my shoulder blade, but my PS looked confused when I said something.  Glad that feeling is gone now.  I hope my story helps you.
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Feb 4, 2014 11:59AM HappySpring13 wrote: Njmom - I'm sorry they had to cancel your port date. I know you were so hoping to get the drains out. How is the output on the drains? Putting coconut oil on daily to help the skin stay soft so it can stretch. I am so happy to be finally done with that!  Can't wait to get my squishes. Not that the Natrelle 410's are that soft, but softer than TE's.   Just wanted to share my latest events.

Posts.Content: Feb 12, 2014 03:46PM HappySpring13 wrote: Warrior you are so right...this decision is really hard. No matter how many pictures I see or posts I read I am still on the fence. On the picture forum on page 2 titled From TE's to Sientra Implants the author got the anatomicals back in 2013 and I was hoping she would post a picture because no matter where I look I've never seen how the Sientra's look.  I even bumped the thread 2 weeks back or so and no reply.    My PS is considering 410's FF probably 535 cc.  I'm thinking and thinking which is hurting my head that maybe I should go for 595 cc if it is at all possible.  I refuse any further fills.  Also thinking about the Mentor HP....then rippling can be more of an issue. I still have a little time to figure this out.  However with the Sientra's, they are softer than the 410's.  But I don't think they go as big as the 410's.    I have another question at hand.  My left side is larger than the right side.  Even though they are filled exactly the same at 500 cc. PS said it could be the shape of my chest wall.  He said he would put the same size implants in and on the small side he would even it out with the fat grafting. Now would that side then be way softer than the left?  I'm thinking he should go with a smaller in the left and larger in the right.  Would this be correct in thinking?

Posts.Content: Jan 24, 2014 09:39AM HappySpring13 wrote: Thank you everyone for all getting on board with this question and posting the links.  It does get confusing and I will discuss further with my BS my path report and my private doctor before blood draws and BP.  I thought when I had my BMX and if I didn't need chemo or rads, I was good to go.  I guess we are really never truly good to go and have to live with all that comes with having bc for the rest of our lives....*sigh* And this really cold winter is a downer too.  But spring is around the corner!
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611

Posts.Content: Jan 9, 2014 04:35PM - edited Jan 9, 2014 04:36PM by HappySpring13 I had 300cc at time of surgery, then 50cc and 50cc on Monday total 400cc.  All I can say is that it doesn't hurt when they do the fill, but for 3 or 4 nights after the fill, I wake up in pain in the wee hours of the morning. Having to reach for the Advil.  I described the pain to my family as...remember when you were a kid and your friends would give you an Indian Burn on your wrist...well it's like the burning feeling, but goes away as soon as you adjust your position.  During the day I am fine.  But just don't lift or pull things cause that can set you back pain wise.  I made the mistake of vacuuming the rugs cause I felt so good that day, like super woman and boy I did myself in for a few days.  I couldn't even breath it hurt so bad.  And yes, they feel like they are in my pits, but you get used to it sort of.  Also one is higher than the other.  But that is okay cause when they do the exchange it won't be like that.
Posts.Title: December 2013 surgeries bobogirl sandra4611
